sn7.13:1.2: Vātehābādhika is a syntactic compound, “afflicted by winds” (vātehi). It is one of the illnesses noted at AN 10.60:7.4. In Ayurveda, diseases of the winds may have many causes, chief among them faulty digestion.
sn7.13:1.3: In DN 16:5.4.5 Upavāna was said to have been the Buddha’s carare for a long time. The events of this discourse are recalled by him in his verses at Thag 2.33.
sn7.13:1.5: Typically ghee or other oil is recommended rather than hot water.
